quiz.title: DRT System Problems
quiz.subtitle: Unit 7 Quiz 9: Distance-Rate-Time Problems with Systems
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Solving Distance = Rate × Time Problems Using Systems of Equations

questions.question: A boat travels 48 miles downstream in 3 hours. Upstream, same 48 miles takes 4 hours. Find boat speed and current speed.
questions.explanation: Let b = boat speed, c = current. Downstream: b + c = 48/3 = 16. Upstream: b - c = 48/4 = 12. Add: 2b = 28 → b = 14 mph. Then c = 16 - 14 = 2 mph.

questions.question: Plane flies 1200 miles with tailwind in 3 hours. Against wind, same distance takes 4 hours. Find plane speed and wind speed.
questions.explanation: Let p = plane speed, w = wind speed. With wind: p + w = 1200/3 = 400. Against: p - w = 1200/4 = 300. Add: 2p = 700 → p = 350 mph. Then w = 400 - 350 = 50 mph.

questions.question: Car drives from A to B at 50 mph, returns at 60 mph. Round trip takes 11 hours. Find distance between A and B.
questions.explanation: Let d = distance. Time AB: d/50. Time BA: d/60. Total: d/50 + d/60 = 11. Common denominator 300: 6d/300 + 5d/300 = 11 → 11d/300 = 11 → 11d = 3300 → d = 300 miles.

questions.question: Two cyclists start 60 miles apart and ride toward each other. One at 12 mph, the other at 18 mph. A bird flies at 30 mph between them until they meet. How far does the bird fly?
questions.explanation: First find when cyclists meet: relative speed = 12 + 18 = 30 mph. Time = 60/30 = 2 hours. Bird flies entire 2 hours at 30 mph: distance = 30 × 2 = 60 miles.

questions.question: Car travels 300 miles. If speed was 10 mph faster, trip would take 1 hour less. Find original speed.
questions.explanation: Let r = original speed, t = original time. System: rt = 300 and (r+10)(t-1) = 300. From first: t = 300/r. Substitute: (r+10)(300/r - 1) = 300 → 300 + 3000/r - r - 10 = 300 → 3000/r - r - 10 = 0 → 3000 - r² - 10r = 0 → r² + 10r - 3000 = 0 → (r+60)(r-50)=0 → r = 50 mph.

questions.question: Two cars start from cities 400 miles apart and drive toward each other. One averages 55 mph, the other 65 mph. When will they meet?
questions.explanation: Relative speed: 55 + 65 = 120 mph. Time = 400/120 = 3.333... hours = 3 hours 20 minutes.

questions.question: Rowboat travels 15 miles upstream in 5 hours. Downstream, same 15 miles takes 3 hours. Find rowing speed in still water and current speed.
questions.explanation: Let r = rowing speed, c = current. Upstream: r - c = 15/5 = 3. Downstream: r + c = 15/3 = 5. Add: 2r = 8 → r = 4 mph. Then c = 5 - 4 = 1 mph.

questions.question: Hiker walks to summit at 2 mph, down at 3 mph. Round trip takes 10 hours. Find distance to summit.
questions.explanation: Let d = distance. Time up: d/2. Time down: d/3. Total: d/2 + d/3 = 10. Common denominator 6: 3d/6 + 2d/6 = 10 → 5d/6 = 10 → 5d = 60 → d = 12 miles.

questions.question: Two planes leave same airport. One flies east at 250 mph, the other north at 300 mph. After 2 hours, how far apart are they?
questions.explanation: East plane: 250 × 2 = 500 miles east. North plane: 300 × 2 = 600 miles north. Distance apart: √(500² + 600²) = √(250000 + 360000) = √610000 ≈ 781 miles.

questions.question: Commuter drives 40 miles to work. If speed was 5 mph faster, would save 10 minutes. Find original speed.
questions.explanation: Let r = original speed (mph), t = original time (hours). System: rt = 40 and (r+5)(t-1/6) = 40. From first: t = 40/r. Substitute: (r+5)(40/r - 1/6) = 40. Solve: r = 40 mph.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent DRT system solving! You can translate complex travel scenarios into systems and solve.
scoreMessages.70: Strong DRT system skills! Focus on: 1) Identifying with/against current/wind, 2) Setting up D=RT for each condition, 3) Solving the system.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice: 1) With current: speed + current, Against: speed - current, 2) Round trip: time up + time down = total, 3) Catching up: distance gained = head start.
scoreMessages.0: For travel problems: Create system with D=RT for each condition. For upstream/downstream: b+c and b-c. For round trips: sum of times = total. Solve system.
